dismissalText.long: lbw b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Rahmanullah Gurbaz lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 145 (125b 13x4 8x6 177m) SR: 116

dismissalComment.html: LBW appeal, given right away. Gurbaz reviews. It was a shortish ball that kept a bit low, Gurbaz cleared his front leg and tried flicking/pulling it to square leg. Missed it and got hit on the back pad. His stumps were still visible, so the question is whether it's going down leg. Nope, Hawk-Eye shows it would have gone on to clip leg stump. Gurbaz is disappointed but is able to bring out a wry smile. He gets warm reception as he walks back with a raised bat.

dismissalText.long: c Mustafizur Rahman b Ebadot Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c Mustafizur Rahman b Ebadot Hossain 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: Top edges a pull to deep fine leg's left. The fizz there, takes a good catch. Subdued celebrations from Ebadot but he brings out a small salute. It was a shortish ball at the hips, Rahmat didn't try to muscle it but was also unable to keep it along the ground. Mustafizur did well to go the left, shift his body weight to the left, hops and twirls as he takes the catch

dismissalComment.html: Mehidy yorks Hashmat and goes through the sweep to hit off stump. Bangladesh have three in three after 36 wicket-less overs. The batter looked to have premeditated here, went on one knee early and tried to hit it square. Missed completely.

dismissalText.long: c Mujeeb Ur Rahman b Fazalhaq Farooqi
dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Mujeeb Ur Rahman b Fazalhaq Farooqi 69 (85b 6x4 0x6 115m) SR: 81.17

dismissalComment.html: Pulled in the air... and it's taken! Handshakes in the Afghanistan dugout. Looks like Ebadot won't come out. The visitors complete the series win! The bumper was close to the helmet, Mushfiqur swivelled and swiped, didn't get enough. Mujeeb took it easily at deep square leg.

dismissalText.long: lbw b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan lbw b Mohammad Nabi 25 (29b 3x4 0x6 46m) SR: 86.2

dismissalComment.html: Shakib misses the flick and the finger goes up straight away! Shakib reviews it though. That was on a length around off, going on with the angle. Shakib missed it completely as it crashed into his front pad, just below the knee roll. Could it be going down leg, though? Nope, it's clipping and it's umpire's call. Shakib has to go and Bangladesh's day just got worse

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Litton's happening stay at the crease ends as he top edges the pull. Nabi takes a dolly at midwicket Farooqi's angle brought the bouncer in towards Litton's body. The batter was cramped and went through with the shot. Went off the edge, not far from the shoulder, and the visitors have an early breakthrough. Pace: 135kph

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Naim player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Naim player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Naim's struggles end with a chop-on! Farooqi's leaping again. It was a shortish ball that landed outside off and seamed in to go over off, Naim tried to guide it behind square on the off side, with the horizontal bat. But he was cramped for room and was surprised by the extra bounce. He was well in front of the crease as well

headshotImage.longCaption: Najmul Hossain Shanto player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mujeeb darts one past Shanto's outside edge, knocks out off stump! Length ball at 100kph spun away sharply. Shanto closed the bat face and tried playing the line. The turn meant he played down the wrong one. Mujeeb is over the moon, maybe it's just that jump...

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mehidy tries to break loose but holes out to wide long-on! He got a full ball outside off, got close to the line and went to pummel a sweep. Rahmat ran to the right from long-on and took a running catch to end the 87-run stand.

headshotImage.caption: Hasan Mahmud player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hasan Mahmud player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: LBW given right away This one looked dead. Bangladesh have two reviews and Hasan does go for it after a chat. Length ball came in, beat the inside edge and pinned Hasan on the pad. Hawk-Eye predicts it would clip leg stump. So the on-field decision remains

commentTextItems.html: Pulled in the air... and it's taken! Handshakes in the Afghanistan dugout. Looks like Ebadot won't come out. The visitors complete the series win! The bumper was close to the helmet, Mushfiqur swivelled and swiped, didn't get enough. Mujeeb took it easily at deep square leg.

commentPostTextItems.html: 10.05pm So that's that from Chattogram today. A dominant performance from Afghanistan. The third ODI is on Tuesday, so do join us for the action. On behalf of Ekanth and Ranjith, this is Abhimanyu signing off. Good night!

Afghanistan skipper Hashmatullah Shahidi: "Very happy that we won the series and it was a great performance from the team. I thought the wicket was not that easy but the openers had a very good start and played really well. After losing the first wicket, it was not easy for new batters so there were some back-to-back wickets and that put some pressure but we put a good score on the board. From the last series, our bowlers were not bowling in the right areas. But all the players sacrificed Eid for this series. We were in Abu Dhabi working on ourselves. Looking forward [to the World Cup]. From the last few years we have built this team and improving with every series. Hopefully we will do well in Asia Cup and World Cup."

Player of the match is, unsurprisingly, Rahmanullah Gurbaz: "After three-four innings, I was in hard situation, my performance wasn't very good but I can say thanks to captain and coach. They give a lot of support and confidence to me. There was no pressure on me. The pitch was good for batting. It was planned from the coach and captain. Few matches, I was in a bit of a hurry. This match, I took my time. I read the conditions and then it was easier for me. I think credit goes to him [Zadran] as well. The way he played, he is in good form and he is a very good player. Got so much support from him."

Bangladesh skipper, Litton Das (Quotes are not verbatim): "When you win the toss and you bowl first, our bowlers didn't do the job. We were not up to the mark in the field, with the ball and the bat too. The way Gurbaz and Ibrahim batted, outstanding. Credit goes to them. After they got out, scenario was changed. Different ball game. Bowlers bowled well in the end. If you bat, as an opener, 20-25 overs, it is not difficult but you have to control yourself to not give wickets in powerplay because they have good quality bowlers."

9:51pm: Afghanistan seal their third-biggest win (by runs) in ODIs and get an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series. They were ahead from the 256-run stand up top. Farooqi was on fire in the chase, Mujeeb took the new ball and chipped in. The first powerplay accounted for three wickets. Nabi, Rashid joined the party and Bangladesh's middle order crumbled early in the second powerplay. Mushfiqur and Mehidy's resistance took them from 72 for 6 to 159 for 7 but they never got close despite Mushfiqur's 69. Abhimanyu will be here for the presentations. Stay tuned.

commentPreTextItems.html: Hosts need 144 off 42 now. Afghanistan likely one wicket away from wrapping up the series. Farooqi is around the wicket

commentTextItems.html: Bouncer hits the fizz on the helmet, lobs up to short fine. He was ducking and twirling, the ball came from outside his eyeline and hit him literally just below the badge. Batter in good spirits. gets checked up by the physio and seems okay.
Wide on a length, slapped to the right of long-off. This time they take the single on the last ball

dismissalComment.html: Naim's struggles end with a chop-on! Farooqi's leaping again. It was a shortish ball that landed outside off and seamed in to go over off, Naim tried to guide it behind square on the off side, with the horizontal bat. But he was cramped for room and was surprised by the extra bounce. He was well in front of the crease as well

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Litton's happening stay at the crease ends as he top edges the pull. Nabi takes a dolly at midwicket Farooqi's angle brought the bouncer in towards Litton's body. The batter was cramped and went through with the shot. Went off the edge, not far from the shoulder, and the visitors have an early breakthrough. Pace: 135kph

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Naim player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Naim player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Naim's struggles end with a chop-on! Farooqi's leaping again. It was a shortish ball that landed outside off and seamed in to go over off, Naim tried to guide it behind square on the off side, with the horizontal bat. But he was cramped for room and was surprised by the extra bounce. He was well in front of the crease as well

headshotImage.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot

dismissalComment.html: Pulled in the air... and it's taken! Handshakes in the Afghanistan dugout. Looks like Ebadot won't come out. The visitors complete the series win! The bumper was close to the helmet, Mushfiqur swivelled and swiped, didn't get enough. Mujeeb took it easily at deep square leg.

headshotImage.caption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

images.caption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman is chuffed after uprooting the off stump
images.longCaption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman is chuffed after uprooting the off stump, Bangladesh vs Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Chattogram, July 8, 2023

headshotImage.caption: Najmul Hossain Shanto player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Najmul Hossain Shanto player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mujeeb darts one past Shanto's outside edge, knocks out off stump! Length ball at 100kph spun away sharply. Shanto closed the bat face and tried playing the line. The turn meant he played down the wrong one. Mujeeb is over the moon, maybe it's just that jump...

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mehidy tries to break loose but holes out to wide long-on! He got a full ball outside off, got close to the line and went to pummel a sweep. Rahmat ran to the right from long-on and took a running catch to end the 87-run stand.

headshotImage.caption: Hasan Mahmud player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hasan Mahmud player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: LBW given right away This one looked dead. Bangladesh have two reviews and Hasan does go for it after a chat. Length ball came in, beat the inside edge and pinned Hasan on the pad. Hawk-Eye predicts it would clip leg stump. So the on-field decision remains

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Nabi headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi headshot

headshotImage.caption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

dismissalComment.html: Shakib misses the flick and the finger goes up straight away! Shakib reviews it though. That was on a length around off, going on with the angle. Shakib missed it completely as it crashed into his front pad, just below the knee roll. Could it be going down leg, though? Nope, it's clipping and it's umpire's call. Shakib has to go and Bangladesh's day just got worse

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

images.caption: Rashid Khan castled Towhid Hridoy with a wrong'un
images.longCaption: Rashid Khan castled Towhid Hridoy with a wrong'un, Bangladesh vs Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Chattogram, July 8, 2023

dismissalComment.html: Gone through him! The googly is such a potent weapon for Rashid and it does the job again. That ball drifted and pitched full outside off. Hridoy was playing for the turn away but the ball sneaks in to leave Bangladesh four down

headshotImage.caption: Afif Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Afif Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Rashid Khan has another one! Afif falls first-ball! On a length on leg, it goes on with the angle while Afif was looking to flick expecting the legbreak. Takes the edge and lobs up to slip for a simple, simple catch

milestones.description: Ibrahim Zadran and Gurbaz's 256-run partnership is AFG's highest for the 1st wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 141 between Javed Ahmadi and Karim Sadiq
Gurbaz has broken the record for most runs in boundaries (100) in an innings in ODIs for AFG, going past Shahzad's 86
Ibrahim Zadran and Gurbaz's 256-run partnership is AFG's highest for any wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 218 between Shahzad and Karim Sadiq
